intro: Monnina comata, commonly known as the silky monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Monnina comata is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
